result.execSummary:
The defendant Nicholas A Mayzure was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Nicholas A Mayzure is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Nicholas A Mayzure was found guilty of Possess w/Intent-THC (<=200 grams), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(h)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.
May not possess any weapons, including firearms.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.
*  Pay supervision fees.
Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not be in taverns or on any premises licensed for the sale of intoxicating beverages, except restaurants or grocery stores.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Submit voluntarily to random tests of blood, breath or urine.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.  Actively search for full-time employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program.
*  Pay fine of $600.00 and court costs including all applicable surcharges; Drug Surcharge.
*  If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.
*  Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge and notice is given.
Perform 80 hours of community service for a public agency or a nonprofit charitable organization.  May not possess any weapons, including firearms.  Driver's License is suspended for 18 months.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Nicholas A Mayzure

records.addlTxt: Discharge - Regular  kmk

Probation is extended for 12 months for failure to complete AODA Assessment, failure to comply with 80 hours of community service, and failure to pay court ordered obligations.  If DE successfully completes treatment/community service before 12 months and pays all court ordered obligations he will discharge immedietely from probation.
Stipulation to extend probation by waiver of appearance filed by Agent Statz
Court has reviewed letter from Agent Statz and takes no action without a stipulation signed by the defendant or a hearing on the request.
received from Agent Josh Statz
Probation review hearing on May 11, 2018 at 10:45 am.

records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt:
Attorney Thomas Binger appeared for the State. Defendant, Nicholas A Mayzure, appeared with Attorney Philip Edward Marry.  Clerk: PT
Sentencing arguments made.  Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge and notice is given.  Sentence is withheld and DE is placed on probation for 2 years with conditions.   As a condition he is ordered to complete 80 hours of community service.  DE's driving privileges are suspended for 18 months.  Court imposes a fine of $600 plus costs & surcharge to be paid during supervision and any unpaid financial obligations that remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.  Appeal Rights, Firearm Warning & Voting Acknowledgement given.

Attorney Thomas Binger appeared for the State. Defendant, Nicholas A Mayzure, appeared with Attorney Philip Edward Marry. Clerk: PT
Case is resolved.  Count 1 - DE pleads No Contest; found guilty by the court.  Count 2 - Dismissed by the State.  PSI ordered.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for June 1, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing at 03-28-2016 09:00 am.  Date changed from 3/29/16 at 8:30 on the Court's own motion.
Attorney Thomas Binger appeared for the State.  Def. appeared with Atty Philip Marry.  Clerk K. Zirbel.  Case is resolved.  Def. is in counseling.  Plea hearing 3/29/16 at 8:30.  Bond continued.

records.descr: Application for specific judicial assign approved
